RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 1 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 66. Claiming Purse 11300. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races At A Mile Or Over Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. (W V A Races Not Co nsidered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MISS LAUREN stalked the earlier pace from the three path, challenged leaving the three eighths pole, took the nod two deep past the five sixteenths and was kept sharp in the stretch. PUSH rated the pace inside, was met past the three quarter pole and gave chase nearing the seven sixteenths, raced in the three path on the far turn and came back to take second midway through the turn. HOW IS SHE settled in the three and four paths, gave chase from the three eighths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn and came along for third mid-stretch. HERETODAYGONMANANA stalked from the three path, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole, raced in the three path on the far turn and showed little in the lane. LIL SPINNER came away awkwardly and made contact with Waverley then stalked off the rail, moved to even terms past the three quarter pole, dueled from the three eighths but was met leaving the five sixteenths, raced at the rail on the far turn and weakened. CHANNEL SCENT settled off the pace toward the inside, eased out leaving the second turn and showed little response through the backstretch. WAVERLEY was pinched back at the break and saved ground.

ENTRY.NAME: dh-Lil Spinner
ENTRY.OWNER: Lugamo Racing Stable LLC and J R Sanchez Racing Stable

ENTRY.NAME: Push
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace inside,met 3/4,chased 7/16,3p far turn,came back 2nd

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 2 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 91. Starter Allowance Purse 19600. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED FOR A CLAIMING PRICE OF $5,000 OR LESS SINCE DECEMBER 8, 2021. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since November 8 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since October 8 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $8,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: RIDICULOUS settled in the two and three paths, gave chase from the nine sixteenths pole and steadily improved through the backstretch, rounded the far turn about the three path, dug in under steady stretch handling and got up the final yards. GRAN ANDREWS stalked inside, challenged approaching the three eighths pole and drew to even terms at the pole, dueled clear midway on the far turn but was caught in the final yards. I AM THAT I AM stalked off the rail, chased nearing the three eighths pole, raced off the rail on the far turn and ran evenly in the stretch. GOODLUCKCHUCK angled in and rated the pace, came under pressure approaching the three eighths pole, was met at even terms at the pole and gave chase from that point, rounded the far turn at the rail and weakened. CURLIN'S THRILL saved ground early and showed little. RAISE A SPEIGHTS stalked from the three path, picked up the chase toward the seven sixteenths pole but bobbled approaching the quarter and was eased.

ENTRY.NAME: Curlin's Thrill
ENTRY.OWNER: Deckert Jr Robert and Brown Keith A

ENTRY.NAME: Ridiculous
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Ronney W and Eastham Richard

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 3 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 81. Allowance Purse 28400. FOR TWO YEAR OLDS WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Weight, 122 lbs. Non-winners Of Three Races Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since October 8 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances)(W V A Races Not Considered I n Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: FORCE OF JUSTICE took an immediate lead and rated a short lead over Hey Boots through the backstretch, increased his lead through the turn and extended it further under steady stretch handling. IT'S MY RAINBOW gave chase through the backstretch, raced off the rail on the turn and held on for second. STREET TOUGH exchanged contact with CALCULATED LUV leaving the gate then gave chase, rounded the turn off the rail and ran evenly in the stretch. The latter exchanged contact with Street Tough leaving the gate, gave chase through the backstretch, raced off the rail on the turn and finished evenly. BROWN SUGA BABE was not a factor. HEY BOOTS became fractious and sat down in the gate, pressured the pace inside through the backstretch, checked at the rail into the turn then weakened leaving the turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Hey Boots
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W

ENTRY.NAME: Street Tough
ENTRY.OWNER: Gracie Mae Stables and Great Lake Stable

ENTRY.NAME: Force of Justice
ENTRY.COMMENT: immediate lead,rated pace,widened turn,steadily handled lane

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 4 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 89. Allowance Purse 29400. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since November 8 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since October 8 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $15,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: TEACHINTHERELEASE pressured the pace inside, took the nod leaving the five sixteenths pole and raced at the rail on the turn, dug in under steady handling and held on well. EPIC TIME set a pressured early pace, was met leaving the five sixteenths pole, rounded the turn off the rail and ran evenly in the stretch. COLT ROCK engaged in close early chase, raced in the four path on the turn then dueled through the stretch for third. EL LUCERITO gave close early chase but steadied past the seven sixteenths pole, recovered stride nearing the three eighths, raced at the rail on the turn and was outfinished in the stretch duel for third. JUBAY gave chase, rounded the turn about the five path, left the turn outside and flattened stride. PINK DINGHY pressured the pace two deep while between horses, dropped back midway on the turn then flattened past the eighth pole. GOLD FIBER gave chase, raced in the three path on the turn and showed little in the lane.

ENTRY.NAME: Teachintherelease
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace,up past 5/16,rail turn,held well driving

ENTRY.NAME: Pink Dinghy
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace between,dropped back mid turn,flattened lane

ENTRY.NAME: El Lucerito
ENTRY.OWNER: Campbell Marshall T and Bentley Donald L

ENTRY.NAME: Epic Time
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace,met past 5/16,off rail turn,evenly lane

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 5 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 86. Allowance Purse 27400. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since October 8 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allow ances)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: DUNCAN IDAHO accelerated to the front approaching the three eighths pole and rated a short lead, widened at the rail nearing the head of the lane and was steadily handled to late stretch before being taken in hand. WOODLINE gave chase outside, rounded the turn about the five path and dug in to clear second past the sixteenth pole. GOLDEN ARM chased through the backstretch, raced in the four path on the turn and ran evenly in the lane. MALIBU COWBOY gave chase, raced off the rail on the turn, angled to the outside leaving the turn and improved his position. SETTLEMENT DATE chased toward the inside, rounded the turn at the rail and showed little in the lane. BIGZ'S CABANA BOY had a brief early lead then gave chase while tapering in, rounded the turn about the three path and weakened in the lane. GUN FACTOR chased through the backstretch and raced in the four path on the turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Duncan Idaho
ENTRY.COMMENT: up near 3/8,rated pace,widened rail turn,urged to late lane

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 6 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 83. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 24000. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, WAIVER CLAIMING, RESTRICTED OR STATE BRED RACES OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $15,000. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Ol der, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since November 8 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since October 8 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $15,000 (Races Where Entered For $10,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: DIAL HER saved ground well off the pace, started a bid leaving the seven sixteenths pole, angled outward through the far turn and entered the stretch about the seven path, closed steadily leaving the turn and got up the final strides. COMPLETE SURPRISE stalked from the three path the first turn, bid nearing the three eighths pole and took the lead three wide midway on the far turn, dug in under steady handling leaving the turn but was caught in the final strides. SIX THE HARD WAY saved ground on the first turn, bid nearing the three eighths pole and raced in the five path on the far turn, then flattened stride inside the sixteenth pole. EMBERLY raced in the four and five paths the first turn, picked up the chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn about the six path and passed some rivals in the lane. JAMESTOWN ROAD raced off the rail the first turn, gave chase from the three eighths pole and rounded the far turn about the four path, then flattened stride inside the eighth pole. GRACE AND CHARM rated a slim lead inside, came under pressure leaving the three eighths pole and was met approaching the five sixteenths, dropped back at the rail midway on the far turn and weakened in the lane. MIND YOUR OWN stalked the early pace two deep, closed to a brief lead approaching the five sixteenths pole, was caught midway on the far turn, drifted into the lane and weakened. DIALHERUP rounded the opening turn about the four path and showed little response through the backstretch. MYGIDGETMARIE saved ground on the first turn, gave chase from the three eighths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn and weakened.

ENTRY.NAME: Dial Her
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,bid 7/16,angled out turn,7p 1/8,up final strides

ENTRY.NAME: Jamestown Road
ENTRY.COMMENT: off rail early,chased 3/8,4p far turn,flattened lane

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 7 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 88. Allowance Purse 28400. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, WAIVER CLAIMING, RESTRICTED OR STATE BRED RACES OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since November 8 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since October 8 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ROYAL PAIN saved ground well back from early contention, started a bid nearing the three eighths pole and steadily improved, circled rivals six wide on the far turn, dug in for the lead mid-stretch and drew away later yards. NEVERPOPTHECORK settled off the pace about the four path, picked up the chase nearing the seven sixteenths pole, raced five wide on the far turn and dug in to take second later yards. PAYMENGOLD took a quick lead and moved to the inside to rate the pace, came under pressure past the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn at the rail and was caught flattening stride mid-stretch. C R'S MANDATE stalked inside, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn at the rail then flattened inside the eighth pole. I'M THE MONEY MAN settled close off the rail, picked up the chase nearing the seven sixteenths pole but flattened off the rail on the far turn. HOME SCHOOL settled off the rail, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole, raced close in the four path on the far turn then weakened. KRUG stalked from the three path, challenged past the seven sixteenths pole but dropped back at the quarter and weakened in the lane. MARK DID IT stalked from the four path, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole but weakened at the rail into the far turn.

ENTRY.NAME: I'm the Money Man
ENTRY.COMMENT: off rail,chased 7/16,flattened off rail far turn

ENTRY.NAME: Mark Did It
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 8 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 68. Maiden Claiming Purse 10800. FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BLUE HOUR took the lead nearing the seven sixteenths pole and rated the early pace, came under pressure toward the five sixteenths, widened at the rail on the turn and was steadily handled in the lane. EVERYDAYISAGIFT chased through the backstretch, raced at the rail on the turn then eased out entering the stretch and dug in to take second late yards. PRINCESS MIA ROSE gave early chase toward mid track, raced three wide on the turn and finished evenly to take third the final stride. SILVER'S GIRL had a brief early lead then gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole, raced at the rail on the turn and flattened later yards. SONGTELLER chased inside, rounded the turn at the rail and showed little in the lane. HEY MACARENA gave chase outside, raced in the five path on the turn and showed little in the lane. DEAREST M. A. chased toward the outside, raced in the six path on the turn and proved empty in the lane. SHESARUNAWAYTRAIN saved ground.
